title: StreetKhana: AI-Powered Food Discovery
subtitle: Connecting food lovers with authentic street vendors through intelligent recommendations
overview: StreetKhana aimed to solve the discovery problem for street food enthusiasts by creating an AI-powered platform that connects users with local vendors based on preferences, location, and real-time availability.
problem: Street food lovers struggled to discover new vendors and authentic local cuisine. Existing food apps focused primarily on restaurants, leaving a gap in the street food market. Users had no reliable way to find quality street vendors nearby or discover new authentic cuisines.
research: Conducted 50+ user interviews with street food enthusiasts
Analyzed competitor landscape and identified market gaps
Surveyed 200+ street food vendors about their challenges
Created detailed user personas and journey maps

personas.name: Food Explorer Maya
personas.description: Young professional who loves discovering authentic local cuisine

personas.name: Busy Professional Raj
personas.description: Working professional looking for quick, quality street food

solution: AI-powered recommendation engine based on taste preferences and past orders
Real-time vendor tracking with live availability status
Integrated rating system with photo reviews from customers
Multi-language support for diverse vendor base
Secure payment integration with digital wallet support
results: 40% improvement in user retention after first week
85% user satisfaction score in post-launch surveys

title: Hinge App Store Ratings Recovery
subtitle: Strategic UX intervention to recover from declining app store ratings
team: Product Manager, UX Designer, Data Analyst
overview: Hinge faced declining app store ratings due to user experience issues in their onboarding flow and matching algorithm. This case study details the systematic approach to identifying and resolving core user friction points.
problem: Hinge app ratings had declined to 2.8 stars with users complaining about poor matching quality, complicated onboarding, and lack of meaningful connections. The declining ratings were affecting organic discovery and user acquisition.
research: Analyzed 1000+ negative app store reviews to identify patterns
Conducted usability testing with 30 users on current onboarding flow
Deep-dive analytics review of user drop-off points
Competitive analysis of dating app onboarding experiences

personas.name: Sarah, 28
personas.description: Marketing professional looking for serious relationships

solution: Simplified onboarding flow reducing steps from 12 to 6
Enhanced matching algorithm with better preference weighting
Introduced smart prompts to improve profile quality
Implemented feedback loops for match quality improvement
Added safety features and improved reporting mechanisms
results: App store rating improved from 2.8 to 4.2 stars
60% increase in meaningful conversations (measured by message length and response rate)

title: BookMyShow Ticketing UX Redesign
subtitle: Optimizing high-demand event booking flow for better conversion
overview: BookMyShow needed to optimize their ticket booking flow for high-demand events where server load and user urgency created friction points that led to booking abandonment and user frustration.
problem: During high-demand events, BookMyShow experienced significant booking abandonment due to slow loading times, complex navigation, and unclear seat availability. Users were frustrated with the multi-step process during peak traffic periods.
research: Performance analysis during 10 high-demand events
User session recordings analysis of abandoned bookings
Heat map analysis of booking flow pages
Customer service ticket analysis for booking-related issues

personas.name: Concert Fan David
personas.description: Music enthusiast trying to book tickets for popular concerts

solution: Progressive loading with skeleton screens for better perceived performance
Seat hold timer with clear countdown to create urgency without pressure
One-click checkout for returning users with saved payment methods
Real-time seat availability updates to prevent false hope
Fallback options when preferred shows are sold out
results: 50% reduction in customer service tickets related to booking issues
20% improvement in overall customer satisfaction scores

title: Generative UI Prototyping Tool
subtitle: AI-powered wireframe generation for rapid product development
team: Product Manager, Frontend Developer, AI Engineer, UX Designer
overview: Created an AI-powered prototyping tool that allows early-stage founders and product managers to generate professional wireframes and UI mockups through natural language prompts, dramatically reducing the time from idea to testable prototype.
problem: Early-stage founders and non-technical product managers struggled to quickly visualize and test their product ideas. Traditional prototyping tools required design skills and significant time investment, creating a barrier between concept and validation.
research: Interviewed 40 early-stage founders about prototyping challenges
Analyzed time spent on initial design iterations vs. development
Studied existing no-code design tools and their limitations
researched AI-generated design capabilities and best practices

personas.name: Emma, Solo Founder
personas.description: Non-technical founder with limited design budget
frustrations: Steep learning curve for design tools

solution: Natural language processing to interpret design requirements
OpenAI GPT-4 integration for intelligent layout generation
Figma plugin for seamless design workflow integration
Component library with modern UI patterns and Tailwind CSS
Version control and collaboration features for team feedback
results: 10x faster prototype creation (2 hours vs. 20 hours)
85% reduction in design costs for early-stage startups
92% user satisfaction score in beta testing
Featured in 5 major product design publications

title: Credit Card Origination Platform
subtitle: Automating credit card approvals with integrated KYC, fraud checks and scoring
team: Product Manager, Frontend Developer, AI Engineer, UX Designer
problem: Manual approval workflows created bottlenecks in customer onboarding, risk assessment, and fraud prevention.
research: Interviewed 25 credit officers and compliance heads
Audited legacy systems for latency and failure points
Benchmarked top B2B fintechs' origination flow

personas.name: Neha, Credit Officer
personas.description: Manages daily approvals of new credit card applicants

solution: Integrated APIs for Lexis Nexis and Experian KYC validation
Rule-based engine for risk-based application routing
ML scoring model for high-volume automated approvals

title: GenAI Real Estate Lending
subtitle: Smarter loan decisions using LLMs and dynamic borrower intelligence
team: Product Manager, GenAI Engineer, Risk Analyst
problem: Legacy loan systems failed to account for nuanced borrower behavior and contextual risk factors.
research: Evaluated loan applications with high default risk
Interviewed 15 loan underwriters on decision complexity
Benchmarked success of LLMs in legal/financial NLP

personas.name: Rajesh, Loan Officer
personas.description: Assesses real estate borrowers and approves large loans

solution: ChatGPT-based risk profile summarizer
LangChain agent to validate borrower info and property trends
Creditworthiness scoring enhanced with market intelligence
results: 30% more loan approvals with same default rate
Enhanced trust in GenAI models by risk committee

title: Product Demo Acceleration
subtitle: Streamlined product demo readiness using workflow automation
team: Product Manager, Solutions Engineer, QA Lead
outcome: Reduced demo TAT from 6-9 months to 1 month
problem: Demo environments took months to prepare due to siloed tooling and inconsistent data.
research: Shadowed sales engineers during demo prep
Audited 10 live demo pipelines for inefficiencies

personas.name: Julia, Solutions Consultant
personas.description: Delivers pre-sales demos for enterprise clients
goals: Set up quick and clean demos

solution: Prebuilt demo orchestration scripts
Auto-provisioned sandbox environments
Shared demo library with version control
results: Higher lead-to-close ratio via faster delivery

title: Third-Party KYC Integration
subtitle: Consolidating compliance tools into a unified KYC pipeline
team: Product Manager, Backend Dev, Compliance Analyst
problem: Scattered compliance checks slowed down user onboarding and created duplicate fraud signals.
research: Mapped user journey across 3 KYC vendors
Reviewed 500 flagged user profiles
solution: Unified API gateway for Lexis Nexis, Experian, and CrossCore
Centralized KYC decision engine with scoring logic
Audit trail for all vendor responses

title: NetOxygen Launchpad Admin Portal
subtitle: Developer-facing tools for streamlined product configuration
problem: Developers lacked a unified interface to manage and test configurations, causing errors and rework.
research: User shadowing with product developers
Analyzed config rollback tickets
solution: Centralized config portal
Role-based access for safety
Preview environments with real-time testing

title: Ovis CRM for Fitness Coaches
subtitle: A lightweight CRM to power solopreneurs in the fitness industry
team: Solo Founder, React Developer, Product Designer
outcome: Successfully launched MVP with 50+ fitness coaches
problem: Fitness professionals relied on spreadsheets and WhatsApp, leading to inefficiencies and lost clients.
research: Interviewed 25 gym trainers and personal coaches
Benchmarked features from fitness CRMs like Trainerize

personas.name: Ravi, Gym Coach
personas.description: Tracks client progress, workouts, and payments manually

solution: Client tracker with notes and progress logs
Automated reminders for sessions
Embedded payment and analytics dashboard
results: Received interest from local gyms for white-labeling
